alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:26AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF STEADY SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE MORNING COMMUTE... A band of snow currently draped along the Sterling Highway corridor from Kenai-Soldotna east is gradually shifting north this morning. Steady snow ongoing over Kenai-Soldotna will taper off from now through 7am as the snow shifts north. Meanwhile snow will increase in intensity along the Seward Highway corridor, Anchorage, and the Glenn Highway from 7am through 10am, with areas further north starting later. Expect reduced visibility on the highways due to high speed vehicular traffic, along with slick spots developing on the roads, especially less- traveled neighborhood streets. Motorists are urged to slow down and plan for extra time to get to your destination. The snow shifts north into the Mat-Su by midday. The combination of daytime heating and developing southeasterly winds area-wide will result in rapidly improving conditions by the early afternoon.

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound
